remarks: In dimension zero, any two points are equal.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Apr-2019.)
statement:
tgbtwndiff.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tgbtwndiff.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
tgbtwndiff.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tgbtwndiff.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tgbtwndiff.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
tgbtwndiff.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
tgldim0itv.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
tgldim0itv.p $e |- ( ph -> ( # ` P ) = 1 ) $.
tgldim0itv $p |- ( ph -> A e. ( B I C ) ) $.
